review: New waiter learning the job but good overall experience for a time out with friends.

We recently visited this Chili's restaurant late one Saturday. It was one of, if not the worst dining experiences we've ever had. At around 9:00PM, well after dinner rush, the place was a bit less than half full. We figured it would be a quick process to order eat and exit. Boy were we wrong. It started okay with a quick drink order. I also ordered a cup of their southwestern spicy chicken soup with chicken and charizo sausage. It came out piping hot and had a nice kick to it. So far so good. By then we had put in our entree order, mine being their baby back ribs, and my wife ordering their buffalo chicken sandwich. And here is when things went downhill. Close to 40 minutes later, no entrees. By now the place was maybe just 25% full. Our server had come by twice over this period promising our entrees would arrive soon. Yet 40 minutes later, customers who came in after us were being served, while we waited. At one point our server brought entrees to one of these later arrived parties, glanced over at us, and quickly turned away in what appeared to be embarrassment. Minutes later the manager came to our table apologizing for the delay, but not offering an explanation. He promised our order would be out soon and that he would pick up the tab after a 35 minute wait, which was really about 45 now. Okay we thought, free food. Well about 15 minutes the food finally arrived and again the manager noted there would be no check. If this is how it ended, it would have been alright. But the food quality was poor to pitiful. We had the feeling they rushed the food out to try and satisfy us. Wrong!!! The ribs were dry, especially the half rack with a rub. And there was little meat on the BBQ ribs. This was the poor scoring entree. The pitiful score fell on the buffalo chicken sandwich. The bun was stale, and what should have been a chicken patty dripping in buffalo sauce was a bland dry patty with a single, hardly noticeable teaspoon of the sauce. We pointed this out to the server who was really embarrassed, offered to take it back for a new sandwich, but by now we couldn't afford to wait another 45 minutes. We ate what we had and left. It is important to note that our server was fine throughout this visit, full of apologies. Whatever the issue was, it was all in the kitchen. The manager did the right thing as well by picking up the check. For these reasons they get a very generous 1.5 stars, rounded down to one.

Here is my 6 year update.  I had actually forgot that I had been here and Yelped this place.  Guess mentally blocked the bad experience last time.  Well in 6 years, not much has changed. It is still; the standard classic of a chain restaurant. Still heavy greasy, over salted, overcooked food. The Margaretta was eh- pre-measured to the drop, and overly sweet.  The young high school waitress with pink hair actually did an ok job, was attentive.  We sat in the bar area, and just chilled after a long day.  We did not enjoy the food. So many better places to go.

When my fiancé and I decided on a night out we picked chili's because it was out of our normal region for restaurants. After a 20-25 minute drive we were greeted by a man in torn jeans drinking a soda at the door. The real host was too busy writing something down to take notice of us. The place is loud, like louder than your average restaurant. You go to relax and end up with a headache from the screaming children and kitchen noises.  I would rate the food a B+ at best. The burger was undercooked then what was ordered, and the fajitas were chewy and covered in inedible skin. Even the "cheese sticks" were greasy. They claim to recycle their grease, well apparently it is recycled onto their products. They have a 2 for 20$ deal that most chain places have these days, but your better off visiting another chain with this deal. They did not have that many options in the appetizers section and the choices in the entree section are your standard fare. At least at some other chains then you might be able to hear your server. Overall the server was a nice enough girl, and as attentive as most servers are. It was a bit difficult to hear her over the noise level, and she did seem as if she had a hard time hearing us at points. She was fairly quick and made sure to get us our food out quickly, which is a saving grace. Overall from the moment we walked in it was one of the least relaxing places I had been in a long time, and I left feeling sick and with a headache. Not somewhere to go if you want to have a date, at least not in the evenings. Better for a large group of "the guys" hanging out, or perhaps for lunch.

This is a typical chain restaurant that you see up 28.  I've been here numerous times and one thing is consistent, the wait staff is very good.   I have never had an issue with any waitress at this place, and have had a bunch.  The food is hit or miss ranging from average to pretty good.  4 out of 5 times, the food is exactly how I expect it, but that 1 out of 5 isn't even all that bad.  Maybe a tad overcooked or whatever, but still good.  What I like about this Chilis is it's never super busy but not empty enough to wonder what's wrong with the place.  On weekend nights you can expect a 15-20 minute wait, but other nights you can get right in.

We go there about once every 2 mos or so and it is usually good. I get the triple play getting the buffalo chicken, chicken crispers and the sliders. The last 2 times the chicken was over cooked and dry. The crispers looked like they were cooked in burnt oil. I should have spoke to the manager but I didnt. Must be a new cook. My kids food was ok. Beware of the chicken!
Shrimp tacos and rice were lukewarm but black beans hot. Waitress sat down next to me to take my order.

This is the worst chilis. It's dirty and the food is gross at this one. I generally like chilis food but there is always something yucky about the food at this one. The staff is usually pleasant. Sometimes not. The biggest pet peeve that I had was that they advertised free wifi all over the place but I didn't see any wifi on my cell in the bar area. I asked bout it and they explained that the wifi just doesn't reach the bar area. That's just plain stupid.

It's pretty average here. Nothing to really rave about. This location is right on 28 so it's great for a quick lunch while shopping or a dinner date. They could be cleaner, I always feel like it's so dirty which is not something you want to feel while eating. The drinks are okay and the food is not much better. Happy hour has some good deals. The menu has a large selection!

We've been to this one a few times - its sub-par compared to other Chili's. Food is hit or miss - but we've had pretty good luck overall. Our most recent visit was for lunch shortly after open - sat in the bar area - we sat there so I could watch Sportscenter - about 2 mins after sitting down - half the TV's in the bar froze and stayed frozen for the remainder of our visit and nobody seemed to care. With no TV to watch I noticed the table was sticky so we switched to a less sticky table.  Decided to get on the "free wifi" - and it was also not working. Go figure. We ordered our food - took a bit but wasn't bad overall. Typical Chili's. Our waitress was pretty cool and service was good but there weren't many other tables seated. Went to the bathroom on the way out and found the men's bathroom was full of water - literally - water on every corner of the floor compliments of leaky faucet. Seeing that made me wonder about the rest of the place.  If I had seen it prior to eating - I would have left.  If I see a flooded bath at 10P I can blame it on a long day or a drunk guy - but 45 mins after opening is tough to justify. Again - nobody seemed to care that water was flowing out from under the bathroom door. The place overall has a "blah" feeling. The staff does the best they can and the service and food is good. If I had to guess - the overall problem with this place is management.  You can't expect the 20-something wait staff to fix the core problems with a restaurant.  Leaky faucets and TV/wifi down are things a good manager would get taken care of immediately.  I'm sure we'll return but I'm in no hurry. I'll try to remember to update.

After all of the commercials regarding their new Mexican entree's I could not wait to try them.  They looked great on TV and in the menu, yet they were horrible and we were so disapointed.  I got the $10 Chipolte Cantina Bowl, it was very small, the bowl looked half of the size of what was featured in the menu.   It was also cold, tasteless, the rice was undercooked and crunchy, the avocado slice was very small and there was aboslutely no flavor to the bowl at all.  Chipolte is much better, and to me that is saying a lot.  I am not sure if it is just the kitchen does not care at this location, as our meals were a mess, thrown together.  My daughter was the smart one and she got a burger that was very good.  The Enchillada meals were also flavorless and cold, and just unappetizing overall.  I lerned the hard way here, when you want Mexican, best bet is to go to a real Mexican restaurant.  The saving grace of the meal was our server, she was excellent.   STAY AWAY FROM THEIR NEW MEXICAN MENU !
Well I tried to eat here, but the hostess chased someone out the door to say goodbye as we entered. We waited for five minutes while all the rest of the staff ignored us and gave up.

Chilis is above and beyond my favorite restraunt!  This particular one is as good as it gets Never have i had my order messed up and I have always been given excellent customer service.  Hard to say that now a days about an establishment, Good prices too compared to other places but wow this one is fantastic My #1 recommendation  any time.  Keep it up

The food was great! It was hot, adequately seasoned, huge portion. But our favorite part of the experience here was the waiter, Johnny. He was attentive but not smothery, he was friendly, he was thoughtful. It made such a difference to us to have such excellent service. Thank you!!

When I went here with my friend,  we ordered two salads. It took 30 minutes ( there were only two other people in the restaurant). When we got our food,  my friends found a small cockroach in her salad!  We told the waitress who shook it off and said ' it normally happens because it's from the company that gives them the salad.  Yea,  okay.  They did remove the salad from the bill,  but we seriously could have walked out without paying.  The waitress forgot us and we had to call her over.  I would never ever go back to this chilis.  I hope a good health investigator scans and looks at these recurring issues. If not,  close it down.

They managed to not mess anything up! Got a good waitress this time. The food is pretty average at Chilis. Nothing too amazing. The last time I went to this location we waited 45 minutes for our food which never came.

Went there tonight. With my wife and daughter  waitress was very good.  Food was cold ribs were not hot. Not  impressed. It will be a long time before I go back. U can get better somewhere else for the money.

Slow service, order mishaps are a regular occurrence. We just went back to try it again after several months and we spent 2 hours there, 90% of that time waiting for service or waiting for food. Will not go there again.

Went to Chili's in Salem NH with my wife tonight for apps and a drink. After sitting down at the bar the bartender erupted that food from the kitchen was on hold. She the walked away no drink no nothing. She would have been better off serving at the local prison or better yet as a prison guard. The manager apologized and tried to make it right. I feel that the only real way to make it right is to be a little more selective on who you put behind the bar.

Worst Chili's ever.   We waited 45 minutes and we still didn't even get the appetizer - Fried Pickles. Really? How hard is it to make Fried Pickles? Plus there were like 8 tables empty around us so the grill wasn't busy. So sad. So sad.
Have not been here in a year and will not be coming back. My husbands plate was dirty- fajitas were so dry I could not eat.

This used to be my favorite Chili's to eat at.  Tonight was  VERY disappointing.  The chef lacks quality and care into what he served and the food check person was also as careless and lacking in food prep.  I got very few THIN slivers of steak with a chunky and fatty piece of steak.   I didn't come here to pay for crap!  If you don't enjoy your job as a chef then don't work as one.  Idk what kind of culinary school you went to but u should go back.  I don't work hard each day to throw my money away for crap.  I get that this isn't a high end establishment but it was always a descent place to take you family to once in a while.   We are a very busy family so going out to dinner is a huge treat for us.  Tonight was a total disappointment from Chili's kitchen.   The only reason I gave it 1 star is because our server was great.  I hope management takes notice and fixes this issue or they will start losing customers.

Service = Close to nothing.  I don't think anyone was trained Food Quality = Severely lacking, if they bring you what you actually ordered. I was told I wouldn't have to pay for the dish I didn't order that they brought out to me...whew!  Thank god I didn't have to pay for something I didn't order. My entire experience here was unfortunately disturbing.  I work in the restaurant industry and never realized how even just a little training can go a long way.  No personality in anyone working.  No sign of any managers.   When my shrimp tacos came out, 50 minutes later,  they were cold, and not cooked....at all.  Won't go back....ever.

This place sucks! Sat down right away. Waitress didn't come over to the table for at least 15 mins to introduce herself and take our drink orders. When she finally came over to us she had no expression on her face! We ordered two bottled waters and a soda. That came 15 minutes later. We decided to place our order because she didn't even ask us. We ordered the wings for an appetizer and also ordered our dinner just to be on the safe side. 30 mins later the wings arrived. They were not even cooked. So by then my bf was getting really pissed and it takes a lot to piss him off. He called the manager over and told him about the sucky service. The manager apologized and said if there is anything you need let me know. So my bf said how about our meal? He personally went into the kitchen and brought it out himself. The fajitas were set down in front of us with a steaming hot pan but the chicken was ICED COLD!!! My bf walked into the kitchen and got  the manager. He told him the food was cold. He said to him touch the meat it's cold. The manager said no I believe you and it went back and fourth and we just decided to get up and leave. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else!!!!!

Possibly the worst meal I've ever had. Ordered 1/2 rack ribs that was supposed to include potato wedges and steamed brocolli- vegetables didn't come- potato wedges were nothing more than french fries- meat was just warmed up with some type of sauce on top- never asked if I wanted refill on my iced tea. No service whatsoever. Then I was asked if I wanted to fill out a survey- Evening before I had a great meal at Applebees- will never go back to Chilis

The place wasn't that clean so I though I would be safe to go with a salad, NOPE!  Food came with a hair in the plate in clear view of both the people who cooked the food as well as the wait staff, yet it still made it's way to the table. No one at my table wanted to eat their food after they saw my plate so we sent it all back. The restaurant made us pay for all the food but the salad. Never going back to this Chili's

Someone needs to have a serious talk with the chef here. No I don't consider Chilis to be 5 star fine dining but the one in Methuen MA is delicious. This one was awful. A veggie burger should not have my husband running to the bathroom for the rest of the day (sorry to be gross). My shrimp fajitas were undercooked and slimy, drowning in grease. We threw away our to-go boxes immediately. Both of us were sick for the rest of the day.  The waitress was actually a little TOO attentive and seemed like she wanted us out of there!! we went during lunch and it was not busy at all.  She took our appetizer dish before we were done, seemingly in anticipation to bring the food out. We hadn't even taken a bite when she asked how everything was tasting, and had  just started eating when she almost started to take our plates, and then said "oh I see you're still working." Better than having poor service but it was kind of annoying.
Average chili's  2 for 20 menu is better than Applebee's therefore 4 stars for good cheap meal  Loaded fries is the best appetizer  Burgers are good  Steaks are good Sides are good

Walked in and sat at a table and looked around at the filthy, disgusting dining room. Told the waitress it was disgusting and we got up and left.  If the dining room is gross, imagine what the kitchen looks like! No thanks!!!!
Excellent employees from the hostess to the waitress to the cooks. Very welcoming and excellent food. This location never disappoints, keep it up guys!

This location has been going downhill for some time now, we went for lunch and were told about this amazing new smoker they built, however we couldn't get the wings which are cooked in the smoker because they started the fire late and the smoker wasn't ready to cook on at lunch time. We took a break from Chili's but recently decided to give it another chance and sat in the bar area which was about 30% full.  It took quite a while before the server came to our table and took the drink order and on her next visit to our table she delivered 2 sodas and took our appetizer order.   The Skillet Queso came out was slightly warm and I actually was able to pick up the serving dish with my bare hand and I received the beer that I ordered when we 1st sat down.   When the meals came out, she made a mistake with 1 of the 3 and she also made a mistake on the table next to us and this is consistent with this server because we had her before. So again very disappointing with the lack of service from the server to the kitchen and I was not surprised with the many other negative reviews posted for this location and Chili's needs to read then and correct these issues because there are many other food option on Route 28 and in the mall.

We were shopping in the plaza across the road and began to get "hangry" - frustrated with the crowds and extremely moody due to an empty stomach / low blood sugar. So I suggested that we run across the road to this Chili's location. I didn't realize how big of a mistake this would be. We entered to seven or so groups of families waiting to be seated. Since it was just the bf and me, we opted to sit in the bar area in hopes for faster service. How wrong we were. It seemed that there was only one server for the entire bar area, so we didn't even get our order taken until 10 minutes after we sat down. Another 10 minutes, our water arrived, and we finally placed our order.  How long does it take to make a side salad?  25 minutes later, the side salad came out. Are you KIDDING me? I can't imagine it takes 25 minutes to throw some leaves, goat cheese, and vinaigrette on the plate. As I'm writing this, we still haven't gotten our entrees yet and it's going on 45 minutes of us having been in this establishment. This is a frank reminder of why we don't ever come to Chili's. Never again.

Chilis isn't too bad. Had some bad experiences but not at this one. Its open later than most food spots. We couldn't find anything else for a wednesday night. I got a burrito (as usual) which was better than I figured it'd be. Waitress was nice. I'm very neutral about chilis. Will be back I assume.

Chili's was always my favorite chain restaurant. I love Tex-Mex. This location, however, is getting worse and worse the more I come here. The problem is the service. Though some say the food is a hit or miss, I for one never had any issues with the food here. I love the southwestern egg rolls, fajitas, and Big Mouth Sliders.  But waiting 45 minutes just for the appetizer is unacceptable.  Hopefully now that they're hiring, the situation will improve.

Quality in food has gone downhill. Went for dinner and there was a immediate smell of old water when you walk in. Maybe it was from the draft beers but it is very noticeable. The bathrooms were dirty as well. The service was great but the food was awful. It really used to be better. To bad

It was everything I expected. The meal was awesome for the value. The service was warm and friendly. The restaurant was warm and inviting. Can't really understand the negative feedback. I guess if you go expecting a top notch dining experience when your ordering a dinner for two for 20 bucks.  You might be dissapointed. It's casual dining people and for my money, it was a great experience.

Never really had great service when eating here.  The food is always sub par and not great.  This last time we sat in the bar lounge area on the high top tables for lunch.  During the week we only have around an hour for a lunch break and we ended up being there for almost an hour and 1/2.  The double burger lunch was meh.  I asked for the checks and then had to remind the waiter about the checks 15 minutes later.  Add this to a place I never go back to again.

Just came back from having lunch here.  There were five of us and we asked the waitress to split the checks 2 - 2 - 1. The food was very good, but the waitress wasn't. She had to be reminded multiple times to bring limes for one of us, pickles for another and sour cream for another.  When we were done, one of us asked for a container to bring their lunch home and she said "I have to wait to get a container".  HUH? When she brought the three checks, she just dumped them in the middle of the table and left.  A good waitress would have handed the correct check to the correct customer.  This was very tacky !!!! Took the edge of an otherwise good meal.

I've eaten at many Chili's over the years and recognize the chain to be middle of the road and do not have higher expectations than that.  The Chilis in Salem is really far below the average Chili's.  I took my daughter and 3 grandchildren there today for lunch.  The first thing I noticed at the table we were directed to, was that is was dirty, having a layer of greasy scum type material on all the wooden surfaces which encompass the tile top.  The tile was less than stellar as well.  I asked to move to another table which was about the same.  The tables are all filthy.  Even the windows were disgusting with grime and finger prints and in some areas food drips.  I mean I know kids will touch windows, I had 5, but these windows look they haven't been washed in a very long time.  Tables, you could scratch a name into the grease with a fingernail!  The manager came over when we said we were unhappy with the food and did credit one dish which was the fajitas.  Poorly prepared, certainly not grilled, as the menu indicated.  "Oh we got rid of all the grills, we don't grill anything here anymore, just heat it on conveyor belts!"  Yuck, um your menu says grilled.  It was all just horrible from start to finish, and this is the first time I've ever written a restaurant review that was negative.  I'm not a complainer!!  Never again!  Server was OK, thus the 1 star.  Took forever for them to produce this food, poorly prepared, the place was empty!

I'm not surprised this location has only a 2-star rating. It's not management's fault their patrons consist of lowlifes who bring small children and have no problem drinking in the company of their small children then driving home.  It is, however, management's fault when patrons have to listen to waitstaff having words about where people are being seated.  Second, I have food allergies. I told our server upon ordering my steak that I have allergies and my steak need to be "naked". No seasonings, no marinades, just salt and pepper. I also told her I wanted to trade BOTH sides for one side salad and I still got charged extra. This doesn't make sense to me, considering the side salad was nothing to write home about and definitely didn't cost most than a baked potato and side of broccoli. Third, the side salad, to my surprise, was loaded with cheese. Usually only Caesars have cheese. I have a dairy allergy so I was picking out all the cheese, the waitress noticed and got me a new salad. That was the one good thing she did. I never send back food because you never know who that's going to piss off. Regardless, it wasn't worth the extra buck for about an ounce of lettuce and a couple of slices of onion and cucumber. Due to my allergies, I brought my own dressing which ended up being the best part of my meal. Fourth, the steak. It was a ribeye and tasted previously frozen. I don't care that it's not a steakhouse. If you can't do it right, take it off the menu. I ordered medium rare, it was closer to medium well but I hadn't eaten yet that day and my friend was already digging into her entree so I said it was fine. I didn't want to eat alone because my friend would've been done her lunch by the time my probable floor steak would've arrived.   Lastly, my friend had 2 to-go containers and our server didn't offer her a bag. She was LUCKY we left her 15%. We had to ask the very nice hostess for a bag on our way out.  It just wasn't a good experience. Lousy service, arguing waitstaff, overpricing and mediocre food at best. Since my friend enjoyed her food, I'll say mediocre because mine sucked. There are so many places to go in the immediate area, don't waste your money here.

I'd actually give this a half star. Food was cold as if it came out of the refrigerator. The manager only comp one meal. One of our meals was brought out wrong and sent back. We were not offered desert. We did not eat or finish any meals and still paid $40.00. Won't be back again.

Wait staff was excellent but food was pretty bad.  First the CoronaRita was watered down.  I usually love those things but it tasted more like beer than anything else.  Honestly I think the house tequila is the problem.  Second the white queso dip was more like melted cheese.  As it cooled it became hard as a rock.   And lastly the Cadillac fajitas were a soggy mess.   We had fun and my kids were sufficiently occupied with video games but the food was just disgusting.

Legit the best Tex mex in the United States. Chilis in Salem is a great family owned small town restaurant! I love the family atmosphere. I love all the old family air looms from the owner hanging on the wall and ceiling. It brings me back to my childhood on the border. I love going to chilis and drinking corona Rita's until I pass out. The chips and salsa is probably the best iv ever had and the fajitas are breathtakingly delicious. I always give my compliments to the great chefs here. They do it better than anywhere else.  11/10 stars There is a reason why there are always a lot of people here. It's a family owned small town mom and pop Tex mex restaurant that serves up great food.  It's worth the drive here. I drive 3 hours  each way a few times a month to visit my favorite restaurant.
Food was hot and ample. Service was prompt and efficient. Could find nothing to complain about.
Awful service. Female bartender not remotely interested in serving anyone NOT MALE. MR burgers took over 40 min. and STILL never showed up...we finally left. Avoid this place at all costs.

We haven't been here in such a long long time, They have gone down hill and we just never came back.  I was very HAPPY  and pleased  to come back.  Brand New menu all looks great you even have a Kiosk on every table. You can play games, trivia and order appetizers and desserts  you can even pay  your bill.   But.....there is a fee of $1.99 to play that you don't know until you see the food bill.  Anyways I had the steak sirloin bowl  it was really good.  The meat was very tender.  My son had the steak tacos and he loved it great taste.   I always loved the southwestern egg rolls yum.   We will return for lunch

Really sad place where the manager, the greeter (who shows you to your table), and the waitress just DO NOT CARE! The food is EVEN WORSE - charred black, over cooked and downright UNHEALTHY! STAY FAR, FAR AWAY!

So, being totally honest here, working on my Maverick badge and this was the last stop. I had mostly seen Subway Sandwich Shops and gas stations rated below two on yelp, I found this diamond in the rough. A major chain restaurant with two stars. After reading other reviews, I had to check it out. I will preface this with the fact that I arrived at lunch, and not during peak hours. Other than awkwardly standing at the front entrance for 10 minutes waiting for someone to come to seat me, it was actually a good experience. The bartender Mandy was polite, made small talk, and was attentive. Of course I was the only customer sitting at the bar. Food came out right away, and was very good. The staff were otherwise polite. If I'm in the area again, I would pay this place a visit again.

Where we were seated smelled like either old dust or new paint. The chicken in my enchiladas looked & tasted like it was just a can of chicken breast they threw in there without even adding any spices, and my fiance's mashed potatoes were almost definitely boxed. The only decent part of the meal was the street corn.
I took my kids for dinner to celebrate my sons birthday. As always the food was good hot and prompt service

Do not go at lunch time. Waitress is a complete disaster.. running around crazy, talking to customers a mile a minute... waiting for drinks was far too long, food too slow coming out of kitchen. This particular waitress completely unprofessional . Not checking on our needs.  No refills on drinks. Rude tone. Filthy floors, food and crumbs under many tables... and a gross smell on table from cleaner . Can only imagine what kitchen Looks like.  This location needs better waitstaff. This isn't the first time with this waitress. We won't ever be back.
